segment.source: The AdvancedPhotoCapture class allows you to capture High Dynamic Range (HDR) photos.
segment.target: The AdvancedPhotoCapture class allows you to capture High Dynamic Range (HDR) photos.

segment.source: High Dynamic Range (HDR) photo capture
segment.target: High Dynamic Range (HDR) photo capture

segment.source: High Dynamic Range (HDR) photo capture
segment.target: High Dynamic Range (HDR) photo capture

segment.source: \[ Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.
segment.target: \[ Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.

segment.source: For Windows 8.x articles, see the archive \]
segment.target: For Windows 8.x articles, see the archive \]

segment.source: The AdvancedPhotoCapture class allows you to capture High Dynamic Range (HDR) photos.
segment.target: The AdvancedPhotoCapture class allows you to capture High Dynamic Range (HDR) photos.

segment.source: This API also allows you to obtain a reference frame from the HDR capture before the processing of the final image is complete.
segment.target: This API also allows you to obtain a reference frame from the HDR capture before the processing of the final image is complete.

segment.source: Other articles related to HDR capture include:
segment.target: Other articles related to HDR capture include:

segment.source: You can use the SceneAnalysisEffect to allow the system to evaluate the content of the media capture preview stream to determine if HDR processing would improve the capture result.
segment.target: You can use the SceneAnalysisEffect to allow the system to evaluate the content of the media capture preview stream to determine if HDR processing would improve the capture result.

segment.source: For more information, see Scene Analysis for Media Capture.
segment.target: For more information, see Scene Analysis for Media Capture.

segment.source: Use the HdrVideoControl to capture video using the Windows built-in HDR processing algorithm.
segment.target: Use the HdrVideoControl to capture video using the Windows built-in HDR processing algorithm.

segment.source: For more information, see Capture device controls for video capture.
segment.target: For more information, see Capture device controls for video capture.

segment.source: You can use the VariablePhotoSequenceCapture to capture a sequence of photos, each with different capture settings, and implement your own HDR or other processing algorithm.
segment.target: You can use the VariablePhotoSequenceCapture to capture a sequence of photos, each with different capture settings, and implement your own HDR or other processing algorithm.

segment.source: For more information, see Variable photo sequence.
segment.target: For more information, see Variable photo sequence.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: Concurrently recording video and photo capture using AdvancedPhotoCapture is not supported.
segment.target: Concurrently recording video and photo capture using AdvancedPhotoCapture is not supported.

segment.source: Using the camera flash during advanced photo capture is not supported.
segment.target: Using the camera flash during advanced photo capture is not supported.

segment.source: Note This article builds on concepts and code discussed in Capture Photos and Video with MediaCapture, which describes the steps for implementing basic photo and video capture.
segment.target: Note This article builds on concepts and code discussed in Capture Photos and Video with MediaCapture, which describes the steps for implementing basic photo and video capture.

segment.source: It is recommended that you familiarize yourself with the basic media capture pattern in that article before moving on to more advanced capture scenarios.
segment.target: It is recommended that you familiarize yourself with the basic media capture pattern in that article before moving on to more advanced capture scenarios.

segment.source: The code in this article assumes that your app already has an instance of MediaCapture that has been properly initialized.
segment.target: The code in this article assumes that your app already has an instance of MediaCapture that has been properly initialized.

segment.source: HDR photo capture namespaces
segment.target: HDR photo capture namespaces

segment.source: To use HDR photo capture, your app must include the following namespaces in addition to the namespaces required for basic media capture.
segment.target: To use HDR photo capture, your app must include the following namespaces in addition to the namespaces required for basic media capture.

segment.source: HDRPhotoUsing
segment.target: HDRPhotoUsing

segment.source: Determine if HDR photo capture is supported on the current device
segment.target: Determine if HDR photo capture is supported on the current device

segment.source: The HDR capture technique described in this article is performed using the AdvancedPhotoCapture object.
segment.target: The HDR capture technique described in this article is performed using the AdvancedPhotoCapture object.

segment.source: Not all devices support HDR capture with AdvancedPhotoCapture.
segment.target: Not all devices support HDR capture with AdvancedPhotoCapture.

segment.source: Determine if the device on which your app is currently running supports the technique by getting the MediaCapture object's VideoDeviceController and then getting the AdvancedPhotoControl property.
segment.target: Determine if the device on which your app is currently running supports the technique by getting the MediaCapture object's VideoDeviceController and then getting the AdvancedPhotoControl property.

segment.source: Check the video device controller's SupportedModes collection to see if it includes AdvancedPhotoMode.Hdr.
segment.target: Check the video device controller's SupportedModes collection to see if it includes AdvancedPhotoMode.Hdr.

segment.source: If it does, HDR capture using AdvancedPhotoCapture is supported.
segment.target: If it does, HDR capture using AdvancedPhotoCapture is supported.

segment.source: HdrSupported
segment.target: HdrSupported

segment.source: Configure and prepare the AdvancedPhotoCapture object
segment.target: Configure and prepare the AdvancedPhotoCapture object

segment.source: Since you will need to access the AdvancedPhotoCapture instance from multiple places within your code, you should declare a member variable to hold the object.
segment.target: Since you will need to access the AdvancedPhotoCapture instance from multiple places within your code, you should declare a member variable to hold the object.

segment.source: DeclareAdvancedCapture
segment.target: DeclareAdvancedCapture

segment.source: In your app, after you have initialized the MediaCapture object, create an AdvancedPhotoCaptureSettings object and set the mode to AdvancedPhotoMode.Hdr.
segment.target: In your app, after you have initialized the MediaCapture object, create an AdvancedPhotoCaptureSettings object and set the mode to AdvancedPhotoMode.Hdr.

segment.source: Call the AdvancedPhotoControl object's Configure method, passing in the AdvancedPhotoCaptureSettings object you created.
segment.target: Call the AdvancedPhotoControl object's Configure method, passing in the AdvancedPhotoCaptureSettings object you created.

segment.source: Call the MediaCapture object's PrepareAdvancedPhotoCaptureAsync, passing in an ImageEncodingProperties object specifying the type of encoding the capture should use.
segment.target: Call the MediaCapture object's PrepareAdvancedPhotoCaptureAsync, passing in an ImageEncodingProperties object specifying the type of encoding the capture should use.

segment.source: The ImageEncodingProperties class provides static methods for creating the image encodings that are supported by MediaCapture.
segment.target: The ImageEncodingProperties class provides static methods for creating the image encodings that are supported by MediaCapture.

segment.source: PrepareAdvancedPhotoCaptureAsync returns the AdvancedPhotoCapture object you will use to initiate photo capture.
segment.target: PrepareAdvancedPhotoCaptureAsync returns the AdvancedPhotoCapture object you will use to initiate photo capture.

segment.source: You can use this object to register handlers for the OptionalReferencePhotoCaptured and AllPhotosCaptured which are discussed later in this article.
segment.target: You can use this object to register handlers for the OptionalReferencePhotoCaptured and AllPhotosCaptured which are discussed later in this article.

segment.source: CreateAdvancedCaptureAsync
segment.target: CreateAdvancedCaptureAsync

segment.source: Capture an HDR photo
segment.target: Capture an HDR photo

segment.source: Capture an HDR photo by calling the AdvancedPhotoCapture object's CaptureAsync method.
segment.target: Capture an HDR photo by calling the AdvancedPhotoCapture object's CaptureAsync method.

segment.source: This method returns a AdvancedCapturedPhoto object that provides the captured photo in its Frame property.
segment.target: This method returns a AdvancedCapturedPhoto object that provides the captured photo in its Frame property.

segment.source: CaptureHdrPhotoAsync
segment.target: CaptureHdrPhotoAsync

segment.source: ConvertOrientationToPhotoOrientation and ReencodeAndSavePhotoAsync are helper methods that are discussed as part of the basic media capture scenario in the article Capture Photos and Video with MediaCapture.
segment.target: ConvertOrientationToPhotoOrientation and ReencodeAndSavePhotoAsync are helper methods that are discussed as part of the basic media capture scenario in the article Capture Photos and Video with MediaCapture.

segment.source: Get optional reference frame
segment.target: Get optional reference frame

segment.source: The HDR process captures multiple frames and then composites them into a single image after all of the frames have been captured.
segment.target: The HDR process captures multiple frames and then composites them into a single image after all of the frames have been captured.

segment.source: You can get access to a frame after it is captured but before the entire HDR process is complete by handling the OptionalReferencePhotoCaptured event.
segment.target: You can get access to a frame after it is captured but before the entire HDR process is complete by handling the OptionalReferencePhotoCaptured event.

segment.source: You don't need to do this if you are only interested in the final HDR photo result.
segment.target: You don't need to do this if you are only interested in the final HDR photo result.

segment.source: Important OptionalReferencePhotoCaptured is not raised on devices that support hardware HDR and therefore do not generate reference frames.
segment.target: Important OptionalReferencePhotoCaptured is not raised on devices that support hardware HDR and therefore do not generate reference frames.

segment.source: Your app should handle the case where this event is not raised.
segment.target: Your app should handle the case where this event is not raised.

segment.source: Because the reference frame arrives out of context of the call to CaptureAsync, a mechanism is provided to pass context information to the OptionalReferencePhotoCaptured handler.
segment.target: Because the reference frame arrives out of context of the call to CaptureAsync, a mechanism is provided to pass context information to the OptionalReferencePhotoCaptured handler.

segment.source: First you should an object that will contain your context information.
segment.target: First you should an object that will contain your context information.

segment.source: The name and contents of this object is up to you.
segment.target: The name and contents of this object is up to you.

segment.source: This example defines an object that has members to track the file name and camera orientation of the capture.
segment.target: This example defines an object that has members to track the file name and camera orientation of the capture.

segment.source: AdvancedCaptureContext
segment.target: AdvancedCaptureContext

segment.source: Create a new instance of your context object, populate its members, and then pass it into the overload of CaptureAsync that accepts an object as a parameter.
segment.target: Create a new instance of your context object, populate its members, and then pass it into the overload of CaptureAsync that accepts an object as a parameter.

segment.source: CaptureWithContext
segment.target: CaptureWithContext

segment.source: In the OptionalReferencePhotoCaptured event handler, cast the Context property of the OptionalReferencePhotoCapturedEventArgs object to your context object class.
segment.target: In the OptionalReferencePhotoCaptured event handler, cast the Context property of the OptionalReferencePhotoCapturedEventArgs object to your context object class.

segment.source: This example modifies the file name to distinguish the reference frame image from the final HDR image and then calls the ReencodeAndSavePhotoAsync helper method to save the image.
segment.target: This example modifies the file name to distinguish the reference frame image from the final HDR image and then calls the ReencodeAndSavePhotoAsync helper method to save the image.

segment.source: OptionalReferencePhotoCaptured
segment.target: OptionalReferencePhotoCaptured

segment.source: Receive a notification when all frames have been captured
segment.target: Receive a notification when all frames have been captured

segment.source: The HDR photo capture has two steps.
segment.target: The HDR photo capture has two steps.

segment.source: First, multiple frames are captured, and then the frames are processed into the final HDR image.
segment.target: First, multiple frames are captured, and then the frames are processed into the final HDR image.

segment.source: You can't initiate another capture while the source HDR frames are still being captured, but you can initiate a capture after all of the frames have been captured but before the HDR post-processing is complete.
segment.target: You can't initiate another capture while the source HDR frames are still being captured, but you can initiate a capture after all of the frames have been captured but before the HDR post-processing is complete.

segment.source: The AllPhotosCaptured event is raised when the HDR captures are complete, letting you know that you can initiate another capture.
segment.target: The AllPhotosCaptured event is raised when the HDR captures are complete, letting you know that you can initiate another capture.

segment.source: A typical scenario is to disable your UI's capture button when HDR capture begins and then reenable it when AllPhotosCaptured is raised.
segment.target: A typical scenario is to disable your UI's capture button when HDR capture begins and then reenable it when AllPhotosCaptured is raised.

segment.source: AllPhotosCaptured
segment.target: AllPhotosCaptured

segment.source: Clean up the AdvancedPhotoCapture object
segment.target: Clean up the AdvancedPhotoCapture object

segment.source: When your app is done capturing, before disposing of the MediaCapture object, you should shut down the AdvancedPhotoCapture object by calling FinishAsync and setting your member variable to null.
segment.target: When your app is done capturing, before disposing of the MediaCapture object, you should shut down the AdvancedPhotoCapture object by calling FinishAsync and setting your member variable to null.

segment.source: CleanUpAdvancedPhotoCapture
segment.target: CleanUpAdvancedPhotoCapture
